TopicTitle: Is there a way for me (steam) to get 0.25?

Articles.Content: I was wondering if there was a way for me, as a Steam user, to get 0.25 now that I have 0.90? Mainly, I want it to be able to play with Interstellar until it gets updated.

I was wondering if there was a way for me, as a Steam user, to get 0.25 now that I have 0.90? Mainly, I want it to be able to play with Interstellar until it gets updated.

If you right click Kerbal Space Program and select properties, you get window that has few tabs. Click beta and select previous from the dropdown box. That way you can get previous version of KSP.

Protip: You can just copy KSP directory from Steam directory to somewhere else and zip it. That way you can achieve previous versions. KSP does not have any kind of DRM or copyright protection scheme and can be ran with just clicking .exe.

Protip: You can just copy KSP directory from Steam directory to somewhere else and zip it. That way you can achieve previous versions. KSP does not have any kind of DRM or copyright protection scheme and can be ran with just clicking .exe.

Yeah, I did that with 0.23.5 and 0.24.2, but I forgot to do it with 0.25. Thanks for the tip on Steam versioning though.
